xie-etal-2019-text.title: Text-based inference of moral sentiment change
xie-etal-2019-text.author:
Xie, Jing Yi  and
Ferreira Pinto Junior, Renato  and
Hirst, Graeme  and
Xu, Yang
xie-etal-2019-text.paperMotivationText: Moral sentiment for different concepts changes over time. The study of moral sentiment change in NLP is still in its infancy.
xie-etal-2019-text.paperContributionText: The authors propose a text-/word embedding-based framework for investigating moral sentiment change in English longitudinal corpora.
xie-etal-2019-text.paperResultsText: Historical shifts of moral sentiment are reflected in their proposed framework, which demonstrates that moral sentiment change can be revealed by moral biases implicitly learned from diachronic text corpora.  Analyses also show that abstract concepts are more strongly associated with increasing moral relevance over time than concrete concept.s
xie-etal-2019-text.dataOtherText: Google Books, Historical American English texts
xie-etal-2019-text.resourcesOtherText: Historical word embeddings (Hamilton et al. 2016), Global Attitudes survey (Pew Research Center 2013)
